reviewText:
Chicken Invaders 5
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

As our hero is having an extravaganza chicken meal at the famous orbital Space Burger, suddenly the sunlight disappears and the earth is plunged into darkness!   What just happened??  Leaving his chicken feast behind, our hero comes soon enough face to face with Darth Chook (I could not resist) and his intergalactic spaceship â€œThe Henterpriseâ€! Oh no, Darth Chookâ€™s plan is to block the sunlight with humongous black feathers... Doom, doom... doooom!

This game offers 120 chicken waves with three levels of difficulty: Rookie, Veteran and Superstar Hero . Plenty of different weapons to eliminate all chickens.  And be sure to collect as many foods, coins and powerups as possible to accumulate your best score.

Donâ€™t forget keys; pick them up religiously as you can use them to unlock goodies.
The graphics are good and the game runs smoothly.  Chickens invaders 5 is fun to play and makes you smile, just like the previous game in this series, and it is only $4.99.

Positives:
~~~~~~~~

-	Fun to play and makes you smile
-	Game runs smoothly
-	Great price
-	Good replay ability
-	Achievements
-	Trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~~

-	No chicken dinner for me tonight!

A great game to have in your library!

8.9/10

FOLLOW THE CPT FROGGY CURATOR PAGE HERE
voteText: 31 of 40 people (78%) found this review helpful 7 people found this review funny

reviewText:
https://youtu.be/xFLcyRYcyuM
My review will be separated into different parts covering the many different aspects of the game. First a little bit about me:
â€¢ I purchased it in November from Interaction Studios' official website for â‚¬11.25
â€¢ Total gaming time: 19:53:22h + 03:11:00h (from Steam) = 23:04:22h
â€¢ Times I completed the game: 15
â€¢ I have played all previous Chicken Invaders games (11 total - including the special editions)
â€¢ I made a  Video review  ,  Fan trailer  and a  Full walkthrough  of the game.
============================
Now for the actual review:

Difficulty The game has 3 difficulty settings. One of the few differences between the 3 is that the enemies become more bullet spongy than the previous difficulty. If it takes you one shot to kill an enemy on rookie, it will take you 3-4 to kill it in Superstar Hero.
The second thing that changes is that on higher difficulties the enemies drop more keys (used for unlocking stuff), but that's only because the enemies stay longer on the screen. You can get the same number of keys on lower difficulties if you don't kill the enemies quickly.
The third difference is that on higher difficulties you get more points. Points which are completely useless on Steam because you cannot use the official site's leaderboards.

Game length The length depends on the difficulty you play at. I timed the last 3 times I beat it:
â€¢ Rookie: 01:01:34h
â€¢ Veteran: 01:16:16h
â€¢ Superstar Hero: 01:29:28h
This does not include the cutscenes. With a rough estimate I guess the cutscenes are about 35 minutes long. Is that worth the 4,99â‚¬ you will pay for it ? Yes. Is it worth the â‚¬11.25 I payed for it ? Yes. I've completed it 15 times and I am still not bored of it.

Steam / non-Steam versions The Steam version is very crippled and I see no point in owning the game here. If you buy it from the official site you will get so much more content, the most important is:
â€¢ Leaderboards. You can compete against many people in the world.
â€¢ You will get all future special editions for free (judging from Chicken Invaders 4 there will be 4 versions). On Steam you have to buy every one separately. Let's do the math:
You pay â‚¬11.25 for all versions from their site. You pay â‚¬5 + â‚¬5 + â‚¬5 + â‚¬5 = â‚¬20 on Steam. If you don't care about special editions it is still not worth it because you can not use the site's leaderboards.
â€¢ You will get a free Steam key.

Improvements from previous titles ... or the lack there of. This is the same game that it was before. Every game before this one had something unique about it:
â€¢ CI1 had 10 levels repeating until you lose all your lives (you can play forever)
â€¢ CI2 had more than one weapon and the ability to move vertically
â€¢ CI3 had proper working mouse support, overheating weapons and a good storyline
â€¢ CI4 revolutionized the whole genre. So many more weapons. Tilting/zooming camera and so so so many other improvements.
â€¢ CI5 has nothing new. Sure you have 3 unique levels, but the game is the same.
If you are going to buy a Chicken Invaders game, buy CI4, that one is a lot better than this one. The levels have a lot more variety and the enemies and bosses are more interesting.

Weapons We have 3 new weapons in this one. 3 completely useless weapons I should say. They are terrible and I avoid them at all cost. If I play the previous CI games I will not miss these 3. The other problem I have is that you can complete the whole game using 1 weapon: the green one. It is great for everything. There is no need to switch to other ones. This problem is apparent in all CI games, the green weapon is always the best. There should be a reason for me to use the other ones, but there isn't.

Upgrades While playing, randomly an enemy will stat glowing yellow, if you kill it while glowing, it will drop a key. If you collect enough keys you can unlock certain abilities. There are 31 upgrades and you need 3700 keys to unlock them all. In 23 hours I have collected only 1026. The upgrades unfortunately are not that appealing this time. Especially for Steam users. Lots of them are for getting +?% more points. Points which you can't use in leaderboards. Don't get me wrong. These are great.... but for non-Steam users. Most ones are cosmetic and have no point. Others are completely useless as well. CI4 had better unlockables. These ones are not that bad though....... (for non-Steam users)

Options and performance â€¢ Music and sound have different sliders
â€¢ You can adjust your keyboard's sensitivity. WHAT!? When have you seen that in a game!? Awesome feature, unfortunately you would probably never use your keyboard. The mouse works for everything.
â€¢ Togglebles (on/off): Cheats, In-game help, Satelite auto-fire, mission progress.
â€¢ V-sync and a separate frame limiter (goes up to 125 fps), Fullscreen on/off, Letterbox, Show fps, Texture filtering
â€¢ 2 language options, they are adding more currently.
I have no idea why, but the Steam version for me runs like crap. Before/after every wave the game freezes for less than half a second. That half a second is enough to get me killed. The non-Steam version doesn't have this problem. All my other Steam games don't have this problem, even other non-Steam ones. My PC is a beast and runs the newest games on max settings, so this shouldn't happen in Chicken Invaders. Again- the non-Steam version runs fine with no hiccups.

Story It's decent I guess. I like the humor of the game. There's lots of reused jokes however. I like the storyline of the previous 2 games a lot more than this one.

About the company I have big respect for InterAction Studios. Their games have always made me smile and have kept me interested for 10+ years. Their customer support is perfect. I have contacted them 2 times before and they always give fast responses. The last time I contacted them I asked them for my free Steam key. I e-mailed them at the end of the week (late friday). First thing in the morning on monday I checked my e-mails and what do you know.... my free Steam key was there. Even though I was a little disappointed with the newest Chicken Invaders game, I think you guys are amazing and deserve a lot more fame than you have. I wish you the best of luck in the future !
======================

I guess that's everything, I can't think of anything else to mention. If you guys have any questions about the game then leave a comment and I will answer them.
In short I recommend the game, but I recommend Chicken Invaders 4 more. Both games are great, but CI4 will remain my favorite.
Be sure to watch my:  Video review  ,  Fan trailer  and a  Full walkthrough  of the game.

This really is a cluckin good game! I highly recommend it to everyone that has a fear of chickens!

reviewText:
<<WARNING: THIS GAME MAKES YOU HATE CHICKENS!>>

To be honest, I played all games in the series and I have great memories while playing the first and second game when I was young.
This game is simply amazing. It's still the same chicken shooter we know and love, but with new features like online multiplayer and ship customization. The only bad thing it has, is you weapon's power goes down A LOT when you die. And that can make the boss battles wery lengthy and boring.
This time, space chickens are back (AGAIN) to punish humans for what they do to earth chickens. and they have several new troops (like Darth Chickener) and a spaceship named CK-01 Henterprise. They even brought back a familiar boss creature from past games! You know, these chickens always lose and come back with better equipment. It's just like Wolfenstein Series. We destoyed Nazis multiple times and they just came back with better and advanced equipment; and in The New Order, the took all the world under their control...... WAIT A SECOND!...... ARE THE CHICKENS GOING TO TAKE OVER THE WORLD IN CHICKEN INVADERS 6?!

...... Well, if you are a fan of the series, buy this immediately, you will not be disappointed. For others who never played these games before, try it. These games are very well made and this one is waaay better and enjoyable than the previous games.

reviewText: As a fan of the Chicken Invaders series, i was quite disappointed with this entry. Even though it's more of the same -which is good- there are some changes this time around which harm the enjoyment a lot more than they help it.\nExtending a theme from CI4, your ship often rotates (not freely) to add some variety to the levels, but this time around there is a stronger emphasis on pointing you the wrong way and making you wait until you're able to shoot the remaining foes. Furthermore there is an entire chapter devoted to reverse" top down shooting; meaning that instead of the foes at the top and you shoot upwards
date: the foes are at the bottom and you shoot downwards. While it doesn't sound like much
recommended: it is so completely against what you're used to in this type of game that it gets annoying very quickly.\nThe other change related to the rotation is that now the "gravity" goes wherever your engines are pointing
hoursPlayed: so if you're pointing right then the pickups
voteText: eggs and keys will fall to the left. I don't like this change either
helpfulPercent: at least when gravity was always downward you'd know where exactly to look after destroying foes.\nThere are a couple of side-scrolling terrain-avoidance levels
votesHelpful: these are okay but they're basically change for the sake of change. The new weapons are all rubbish and once you've tried them all out you'll be avoiding collecting them because the older powerups are just better.\n\nIt's hard to recommend Chicken Invaders 5 because Chicken Invaders 4 is better in every way
votesTotal: even the story and humour were much better in the previous game. Regardless of if you're new to the series or not
votesFunny: just go with CI4 it's way more fun."

reviewText:
I bought this game on a whim because it was cheap and the name made me smile.
Is it the best game I ever played? No, of course it isn't.
Is it well worth the tiny asking price? Hell yeah!
There's a lot of nice touches that I didn't expect at this price point and it looks and runs great.
It's simple enough for youngsters to enjoy it and there's enough content to keep a (young at heart!) adult entertained for a while too. I found the unlockable extras a bit too slow (they're mostly cosmetic and I just didn't care enough...) and the SQWUARK!" of dying chickens eventually gave me a headache
date: perhaps not one for the alektrophobes.\nOther than those (minor) gripes though
recommended: I liked it. And if you're feeling the urge to kill some chickens
hoursPlayed:
it's much cheaper and easier to acquire than a shotgun license.

Join me for a light-hearted look at Chicken Invaders 5 on Youtube:
http://youtu.be/Ihxb4aQEj40"

reviewText:
Bought this at 50% for Â£1.99, though I'd say the full price is well worth it for what you get.

I've played all the original Chicken Invaders, and love how each new game to the series adds something new and interesting. With this game being new weapons, maps, waves and unlockables.

Took about 2 hours to complete the game on the easiest difficulty, after one failed attempt, enjoyed it with no real sense of tedium. There are many, MANY unlockables and customization to keep you busy, I can see lots more runs before getting bored then coming back to it every now and then.

Overall, it's a great game at a great price.

reviewText: Can't be beat for the price. As a chicken, I find this highly offensive. This is an insult to all chickenkind.\n\nBut it's also a lot of fun. Blast space chickens, get power ups, play with a friend. Lots of different weapons. Good sound, good graphics, simple controls. Everyone can learn to play in minutes but still be challenged by the increasing difficulty of the game.

reviewText:
I'm a faithful fan of this great game since the beginning. 3 reasons why you should buy it :

1) It's FUN as hell
2) The graphics are truly good
3) You can share the fun playing with your family at home or with other players on line !

I hope there will be more Chicken Invaders versions in the future !
